intro: Anagallis collina, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear or pink mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb with hairy stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters and thrives in moist, calcareous soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers have five petals that are often reflexed at the tips. Anagallis collina is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks across Europe and parts of Asia.
